title: Great Wall of China
author: SeargentDC
pages:
The Great wall of
China's construction
began in 1474 by Qin
Shi Huang. He was also
called the First
Emperor.







It is said that as many
as 400,000 people
died during the wall's
construction; many of
these workers were
buried within the wall
itself.






The wall is the longest
man made structure in
the world, with a total
length of about
13170.7 mi or 21196.18
km.







The Great Wall
concept was revived
again under the Ming
in the 14th century,
and following the Ming
army's defeat by the
Oirats in the Battle of
Tumu.
